content.rendered:
Vegas Over/Under: 39.5

Fromal’s Record Projection: 37-45 The Bet: Under with marginal confidence
Rarely does the stars-and-scrubs plan get deployed quite similar to this in professional leagues.
Most commonly used in fantasy sports, the thinking goes that you can overcome a distinct lack of depth and quality secondary players from top-loading a roster. Spend a great deal on a few men, then expect for mere proficiency around them.
Even the New Orleans Pelicans are presently among the greatest examples of this strategy taking root in reality, since they’re surrounding Anthony Davis, DeMarcus Cousins and Jrue Holiday with almost nothing. Rajon Rondo stays a shell of his old self–a helpful shell, but a shell nonetheless–and also Solomon Hill’s torn hamstring can keep him out for up to eight months.
Who is notable? Have a peek at every other man under contract and see whether you can identify the fifth-best healthy participant, assuming the aforementioned four are the best quartet: Alexis Ajinca, Omer Asik, Ian Clark, Jordan Crawford, Cheick Diallo, Frank Jackson, E’Twaun Moore and Quincy Pondexter.
It is likely either Clark or even Moore. And that is a problem, especially when the two bigs are still trying to suss out chemistry.

Read more: usavallblacks.com
